comment._content: Woo Hoo! Close enough? - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16359580 She arrived in Sydney on Saturday 5 March 1927 on a world cruise. First visit, and because the bridge isn't far advanced in this photo, it cannot be later. If you see what I mean! en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RMS_Franconia_(1922)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/39967544@N00] You have to be right, because wasn't the arches of the bridge constructed in 1929ish? Which would mean the only thing that would be constructed in 1927, would be section leading up to the pylons.
